page.title: 10HASELEY MANOR, ARRETON
page.content: This survey finds Haseley once again an important name on the Island's map. At the last Domesday Haseley was a manor in the hands of the king (William 1st), now it is as a tourist attraction. We have spent the last 8 years re-building the house from a virtual ruin. We have discovered that half of the south wing dates almost back to Domesday and we have been re-building the house back to its various periods. Brand new is our craft pottery and we have become one of the larger employers in the Arreton area. Teapots, coffee sets, eggcups, plates are all made here and decorated with our distinctive floral patterns.
